What is the purpose of the `currencyconverters` API in Verus, and how can I use it to retrieve a list of currencies that meet specific liquidity and reserve ratio criteria?

The `currencyconverters` API in Verus is a powerful tool that allows users to retrieve a list of currencies that meet specific criteria related to liquidity and reserve ratios. Specifically, this API retrieves all currencies that have at least 1000 VRSC in reserve, are greater than 10% VRSC reserve ratio, and have all listed currencies as reserves.

To use this API, you can run a command in the format of `verus -chain=VRSCTEST getcurrencyconverters <currency1> <currency2>`. For example, if you want to retrieve all currencies that have a market for Bitcoin (BTC) and Ethereum (ETH) at or above the liquidity threshold, you can run the command:
```
verus -chain=VRSCTEST getcurrencyconverters btc eth
```
This command will return a list of currencies that meet the specified criteria, providing valuable information for users who want to explore different currency markets and their liquidity levels.

currencyconverters` API retrieves all currencies that have at least 1000 VRSC in reserve, are greater than 10% VRSC reserve ratio, and have all listed currencies as reserves
- **E.g. BTC ETH:**
```
verus -chain=VRSCTEST getcurrencyconverters btc eth
```
Will return all currencies that have btc/eth markets at or above the liquidity threshold.
